comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Problem context: This is a basic programming homework to help you understand RNNs. We have removed LSTMs  (and not in scope for exams --- you might see evidence of LSTMs in the code from previous year's versions of this problem) this year since their practical importance has diminished recently (although they can still be useful in certain cases) with the advent of Transformer-based models and the fact that modern state-space models give essentially all the advantages with none of the disadvantages of LSTMs.</paragraph></document>
comments.document: Problem context: This is a basic programming homework to help you understand RNNs. We have removed LSTMs  (and not in scope for exams --- you might see evidence of LSTMs in the code from previous year's versions of this problem) this year since their practical importance has diminished recently (although they can still be useful in certain cases) with the advent of Transformer-based models and the fact that modern state-space models give essentially all the advantages with none of the disadvantages of LSTMs.
